Background  
1. Present Masters admission eligibility criteria was reviewed in 2010, when 
the minimum CGPA  required for Masters admission was reduced to 2.0 out of 
4.0  from  2.5  out  of  4,  to facilitate bachelors students of  NUST  and  other 
institutions.  PhD admission criteria was also amended in 2012 when two 2
nd
 div 
/  Grade C through  Matric  to  Bachelors were  allowed.  A  review  of  existing 
eligibility of Masters admission has therefore become necessary for more clarity 
and to bring it in line with PhD admission.       
Salient Aspects 
2. The   eligibility   criteria   for   Masters admission   has   been   revised   as 
mentioned below:- 
a. 16 years  of  schooling  or  4  years  (minimum 130  credit  hours) 
education after FA/FSc/A Level in relevant discipline. 
b. Minimum CGPA of 2.0 out of 4.00 or 55% marks in terminal degree.
